intro: Vernonella africana, commonly known as African vervain, is a flowering plant native to Africa. It belongs to the family Verbenaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from purple to pink, often attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and open woodlands. Vernonella africana is also used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
